list.name: Assault Rifles
list.description: {%this['name']%} covers the use of all multi-firing rifles.

list.name: Clubs
list.description: {%this['name']%} governs the use of hand-held melee weapons that have no edge or blade and are less than one meter long.

list.name: Cyber-Implant Combat
list.description: {%this['name']%} is a new combat discipline that developed since the advent of combat-oriented cyberware.

list.name: Pistols
list.description: {%this['name']%} covers the use of hold-out, light, and heavy pistols, including revolvers.

list.name: Submachine Guns
list.description: {%this['name']%} covers compact automatic firearms firing pistol-caliber ammunition.

list.name: Rifles
list.description: {%this['name']%} covers single-shot, bolt-action, and semi-automatic rifles.

list.name: Shotguns
list.description: {%this['name']%} covers the use of shot-firing longarms, including pump and semi-automatic models.

list.name: Heavy Weapons
list.description: The {%this['name']%} skill gives the user the know-how to handle anything larger than an assault rifle, including when they are mounted on fixed emplacements (but not on vehicles).

list.name: Launch Weapons
list.description: The {%this['name']%} skill covers the use and targeting of any device that fires a missle, rocket, or other explosive projectile including mortars but no in or on vehicles. This skill covers manual and sensor-enhanced fire, and also governs the use of both specific grenade-launching weapons and underbarrel grenade-launching weapons.

list.name: Gunnery
list.description: {%this['name']%} covers firing vehicle/drone/turret-mounted weapons and smart platforms.

list.name: Throwing Weapons
list.description: {%this['name']%} covers thrown items used as weapons, including grenades and knives.

list.name: Edged Weapons
list.description: {%this['name']%} covers melee weapons with cutting edges such as knives and swords.

list.name: Pole Arms/Staffs
list.description: {%this['name']%} covers melee weapons longer than one meter such as spears, staves, and polearms.

list.name: Projectile Weapons
list.description: {%this['name']%} covers non-firearm, muscle-powered ranged weapons such as bows and crossbows.

list.name: Unarmed Combat
list.description: {%this['name']%} covers striking, grappling, and other hand-to-hand techniques without a weapon.

list.name: Aura Reading
list.description: {%this['name']%} is the skill of psychometry, learning information from people's auras, astral forms, and signatures. It can function as a Complementary Skill for Assensing Tests.

list.name: Sorcery
list.description: {%this['name']%} governs the control of magical energy, usually in the form of spells.

list.name: Conjuring
list.description: {%this['name']%} governs the calling and banishing of spirits. Mages can call elementals; shamans can call nature spirits.

list.name: Athletics
list.description: {%this['name']%} reflects training to perform extreme physical activities and can be used to increase running distance.

list.name: Diving
list.description: {%this['name']%} covers underwater swimming techniques and the use of scuba and other underwater gear.

list.name: Stealth
list.description: {%this['name']%} governs sneaking, sleight of hand, eluding a tail, and the use of camouflage and disguises. Often resolved as an Open Test.

list.name: Etiquette
list.description: {%this['name']%} allows a character to function within a specific subculture without appearing out of place, recognize prominent figures, and know their general traits. See Etiquette, p.94.

list.name: Instruction
list.description: {%this['name']%} allows a character to more efficiently teach something to another character. See Instruction, p.95.

list.name: Interrogation
list.description: {%this['name']%} governs the extraction of information from an unwilling subject.

list.name: Intimidation
list.description: {%this['name']%} allows a character to coerce others through fear, whether as a weaker form of Interrogation or a forceful version of Negotiation.

list.name: Leadership
list.description: {%this['name']%} governs a character's ability to get others to follow through example and authority. It includes aspects of problem-solving, but not as a replacement for player decision-making.

list.name: Negotiation
list.description: {%this['name']%} governs interactions where each side seeks to come out ahead, whether through bargaining, bribery, or fast talk.

list.name: Biotech
list.description: {%this['name']%} governs basic medicine and first aid. A character with this skill understands medicine in a hands-on sense, as a paramedic rather than a physician. Though familiar with cyberware techniques and materials, they still need a computer expert to handle interface systems.

list.name: Computer
list.description: {%this['name']%} governs the use and understanding of computer technology and programming, including decking in the Matrix.

list.name: Demolitions
list.description: {%this['name']%} governs the preparation, measuring, and setting of chemical explosives.

list.name: Electronics
list.description: {%this['name']%} governs the use and understanding of electronic devices, which in the 2060s covers nearly everything in urban life.

list.name: Bike
list.description: {%this['name']%} governs the use of motorcycles, motortrikes, and bikes with sidecars.

list.name: Car
list.description: {%this['name']%} covers the operation of motor vehicles with four or more wheels.

list.name: Fixed-Wing Aircraft
list.description: {%this['name']%} governs the control of fixed- or swing-wing aircraft (jet, prop, turbo-prop) and unpowered aircraft.

list.name: Hovercraft
list.description: {%this['name']%} governs all hover vehicles, regardless of their purpose.

list.name: LTA Aircraft
list.description: {%this['name']%} encompasses the use of all lighter-than-air craft, such as zeppelins and blimps.

list.name: Motorboat
list.description: {%this['name']%} covers the operation of any motorized watercraft.

list.name: Rotor Aircraft
list.description: {%this['name']%} governs the use of rotorcraft, including helicopters and tilt-rotor aircraft.

list.name: Sailboat
list.description: {%this['name']%} governs the use of sail-powered watercraft.

list.name: Ship
list.description: {%this['name']%} governs the piloting, navigation, and handling of large surface ships.

list.name: Submarine
list.description: {%this['name']%} governs the use of boats capable of operating underwater.
